title: Ted Cruz Bashes Billie Eilish Grammy Speech During Netflix Hearing
desc: Ted Cruz pressed Netflix chief Ted Sarandos about Billie Eilish's Grammy speech during a hearing about the company's merger with Warner Bros.

title: Six Nations kicks off with heavyweights Ireland and France, yet Paris looks uninterested
desc: If Ireland are to win, then most likely it will be a bare-knuckle ride

title: Highgrove House welcomes charities on World Cancer Day
desc: The event marks the first of a series at Highgrove House aimed at bringing people together.

title: Winter Olympics kicked off in Cortina with curling, but took a brief pause due to a power outage
desc: The Winter Olympics got underway Wednesday with the first curling matches in Cortina, but came to a halt only moments later because of a power outage.

title: Human Rights Watch researchers resign over ‘pulled’ report
desc: HRW said they concluded “aspects of the research and the factual basis for our legal conclusions needed to be strengthened to meet Human Rights Watch’s high standards.”

title: Wilder vs Chisora: Derek Chisora describes Deontay Wilder as he "brother" as
desc: Deontay Wilder and Derek Chisora strike a friendly tone at the launch news conference for their heavyweight fight in April.

title: Supreme Court lets California use new Democrat-friendly congressional map
desc: The Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed California to use a new congressional map that will undermine President Donald Trump’s effort to keep control of the House of Representatives, marking a defeat for Republicans who claimed one of the new districts was redesigned based on race rather than politics.

title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
desc: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

title: Jigsaw puzzle racing winners crowned at Masters Games
desc: Jigsaw puzzle racing was a new addition at the last Masters Games in Dunedin and it sold out within a day when it returned this year.

title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
desc: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.
